page.title: 12THE FORT: TILBURY
page.content: {The Fort}was built in 1539 to stop invaders getting to London. The fort was based on a strategic pentagon shape. The fort has a chapel and a haord of cannons and cannonballs. There was a hospital but it was knocked down in the 1960s. The fort has an open courtyard and three water pumps (not in use). You have to cross two drawbridges to get to the landgate. Across the courtyard there is a watergate. Under the fort there are a series of underground passages to feed shells to the cannons in war. There are also two magazines and a gatehouse. People can go and visit the fort and walk around.
